verses.text: \w Now|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* allotment \w for|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* \w clans|strong="H4940"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* \w tribe|strong="H4294"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* \w extended|strong="H1961"\w* \w to|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* \w border|strong="H1366"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* Edom, \w to|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* \w Wilderness|strong="H4057"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Zin|strong="H6790"\w* \w at|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* \w extreme|strong="H7097"\w* \w southern|strong="H5045"\w* \w boundary|strong="H1366"\w*:
Their southern border started at the bay on the southern tip of the Salt Sea,\f + \fr 15:2 \ft That is, the Dead Sea; also in verse 5\f*

proceeded south of the Ascent of Akrabbim,\f + \fr 15:3 \ft Or the Ascent of Scorpions or Scorpion Pass\f* continued on to Zin, went over to the south of Kadesh-barnea, ran past Hezron up to Addar, and curved toward Karka.

It proceeded to Azmon, joined the Brook of Egypt, and ended at the Sea.\f + \fr 15:4 \ft That is, the Mediterranean Sea, also called the Great Sea; also in verses 11, 12, and 47\f* This was their \f + \fr 15:4 \ft LXX; Hebrew your\f* southern border.
The eastern border was the Salt Sea as far as the mouth of the Jordan. The northern border started from the bay of the sea at the mouth of the Jordan,
went up to Beth-hoglah, proceeded north of Beth-arabah, and went up to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben.

Then the border went up to Debir from the Valley of Achor, turning north to Gilgal, which faces the Ascent of Adummim south of the ravine. It continued along the waters of En-shemesh and came out at En-rogel.

From there the border went up the Valley of Hinnom along the southern slope of the Jebusites (that is, Jerusalem) and ascended to the top of the hill that faces the Valley of Hinnom on the west, at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim.
From the hilltop the border curved to the spring of the Waters of Nephtoah, proceeded to the cities of Mount Ephron, and then bent around toward Baalah (that is, Kiriath-jearim).
The border curled westward from Baalah to Mount Seir, ran along the northern slope of Mount Jearim (that is, Chesalon), went down to Beth-shemesh, and crossed to Timnah.
Then it went out to the northern slope of Ekron, curved toward Shikkeron, proceeded to Mount Baalah, went on to Jabneel, and ended at the Sea.

And the western border was the coastline of the Great Sea. \w These|strong="H2088"\w* \w are|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5439"\w* boundaries \w around|strong="H5439"\w* \w the|strong="H5439"\w* \w clans|strong="H4940"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5439"\w* \w descendants|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*. Caleb’s Portion and Conquest (Judges 1:8–26)

\w According|strong="H6310"\w* \w to|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w*’s \w command|strong="H6310"\w* \w to|strong="H3068"\w* \w him|strong="H5414"\w*, \w Joshua|strong="H3091"\w* \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* \w Caleb|strong="H3612"\w* \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Jephunneh|strong="H3312"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* \w portion|strong="H2506"\w* \w among|strong="H8432"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*—\w Kiriath-arba|strong="H7153"\w*, \w that|strong="H1931"\w* \w is|strong="H3068"\w*, \w Hebron|strong="H2275"\w*. (Arba \w was|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* forefather \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Anak|strong="H6061"\w*.)

\w And|strong="H1121"\w* \w Caleb|strong="H3612"\w* \w drove|strong="H3423"\w* \w out|strong="H3423"\w* \w from|strong="H1121"\w* \w there|strong="H8033"\w* \w the|strong="H3423"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Anak|strong="H6061"\w*—\w the|strong="H3423"\w* \w descendants|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Sheshai|strong="H8344"\w*, Ahiman, \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w Talmai|strong="H8526"\w*, \w the|strong="H3423"\w* \w children|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Anak|strong="H6061"\w*.

\w From|strong="H6440"\w* \w there|strong="H8033"\w* \w he|strong="H8033"\w* \w marched|strong="H5927"\w* \w against|strong="H6440"\w* \w the|strong="H6440"\w* \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* \w of|strong="H3427"\w* \w Debir|strong="H1688"\w* (\w formerly|strong="H6440"\w* known \w as|strong="H5927"\w* \w Kiriath-sepher|strong="H7158"\w*).

\w And|strong="H1323"\w* \w Caleb|strong="H3612"\w* said, “\w To|strong="H5414"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* man \w who|strong="H1323"\w* \w strikes|strong="H5221"\w* \w down|strong="H5221"\w* \w Kiriath-sepher|strong="H7158"\w* \w and|strong="H1323"\w* \w captures|strong="H3920"\w* \w it|strong="H5414"\w*, \w I|strong="H5414"\w* \w will|strong="H5414"\w* \w give|strong="H5414"\w* \w my|strong="H5414"\w* \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* \w Acsah|strong="H5915"\w* \w in|strong="H5414"\w* marriage.”

\w So|strong="H5414"\w* \w Othniel|strong="H6274"\w* \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Caleb|strong="H3612"\w*’s brother \w Kenaz|strong="H7073"\w* \w captured|strong="H3920"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* city, \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w Caleb|strong="H3612"\w* \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* \w his|strong="H5414"\w* \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* \w Acsah|strong="H5915"\w* \w to|strong="H5414"\w* \w him|strong="H5414"\w* \w in|strong="H1121"\w* marriage.

\w One|strong="H1961"\w* day Acsah \w came|strong="H1961"\w* \w to|strong="H1961"\w* Othniel \w and|strong="H7704"\w* urged \w him|strong="H5921"\w* \f + \fr 15:18 \ft Hebrew and some LXX manuscripts; other LXX manuscripts and he urged her; see Judges 1:14.\f* \w to|strong="H1961"\w* \w ask|strong="H7592"\w* \w her|strong="H5921"\w* father \w for|strong="H5921"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* \w field|strong="H7704"\w*. \w When|strong="H1961"\w* \w she|strong="H5921"\w* got \w off|strong="H5921"\w* \w her|strong="H5921"\w* \w donkey|strong="H2543"\w*, \w Caleb|strong="H3612"\w* \w asked|strong="H7592"\w* \w her|strong="H5921"\w*, “\w What|strong="H4100"\w* \w do|strong="H4100"\w* \w you|strong="H5921"\w* \w desire|strong="H7592"\w*?”

“\w Give|strong="H5414"\w* \w me|strong="H5414"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* \w blessing|strong="H1293"\w*,” \w she|strong="H3588"\w* answered. “\w Since|strong="H3588"\w* \w you|strong="H3588"\w* \w have|strong="H5414"\w* \w given|strong="H5414"\w* \w me|strong="H5414"\w* land \w in|strong="H5414"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* \w Negev|strong="H5045"\w*, \w give|strong="H5414"\w* \w me|strong="H5414"\w* \w springs|strong="H1543"\w* \w of|strong="H4325"\w* \w water|strong="H4325"\w* \w as|strong="H3588"\w* well.” \w So|strong="H5414"\w* Caleb \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* \w her|strong="H5414"\w* both \w the|strong="H3588"\w* \w upper|strong="H5942"\w* \w and|strong="H4325"\w* \w lower|strong="H8482"\w* \w springs|strong="H1543"\w*. The Cities of Judah

\w This|strong="H2063"\w* \w is|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w inheritance|strong="H5159"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w clans|strong="H4940"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w tribe|strong="H4294"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*.

These \w were|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* southernmost \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* \w tribe|strong="H4294"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* \w in|strong="H5892"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* \w Negev|strong="H5045"\w* \w toward|strong="H4294"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* \w border|strong="H1366"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* Edom: Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
Hazor-hadattah, Kerioth-hezron (that is, Hazor),
Amam, Shema, Moladah,
Hazar-gaddah, Heshmon, Beth-pelet,
Hazar-shual, Beersheba, Biziothiah,
Baalah, Iim, Ezem,
Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah,
Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon—twenty-nine cities in all, along with their villages.

These \w were|strong="H8219"\w* \w in|strong="H8219"\w* \w the|strong="H8219"\w* \w foothills|strong="H8219"\w*:\f + \fr 15:33 \ft Hebrew Shephelah or lowlands; that is, the western foothills of Judea\f* Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
Zanoah, En-gannim, Tappuah, Enam,
Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah,
Shaaraim, Adithaim, and Gederah (or Gederothaim)—fourteen cities, along with their villages.
Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal-gad,
Dilan, Mizpeh, Joktheel,
Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
Cabbon, Lahmas, Chitlish,
Gederoth, Beth-dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah—sixteen cities, along with their villages.
Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
Iphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,
Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah—nine cities, along with their villages.
Ekron, with its towns and villages;
from Ekron to the sea, all the cities near Ashdod, along with their villages;
Ashdod, with its towns and villages; Gaza, with its towns and villages, as far as the Brook of Egypt and the coastline of the Great Sea.
These \w were|strong="H2022"\w* \w in|strong="H2022"\w* \w the|strong="H2022"\w* \w hill|strong="H2022"\w* \w country|strong="H2022"\w*: Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,
Dannah, Kiriath-sannah (that is, Debir),
Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
Goshen, Holon, and Giloh—eleven cities, along with their villages.
Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
Janim, Beth-tappuah, Aphekah,
Humtah, Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron), and Zior—nine cities, along with their villages.
Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,
Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah—ten cities, along with their villages.
Halhul, Beth-zur, Gedor,
Maarath, Beth-anoth, and Eltekon—six cities, along with their villages.
Kiriath-baal (that is, Kiriath-jearim), and Rabbah—two cities, along with their villages.
These \w were|strong="H4057"\w* in \w the|strong="H4057"\w* \w wilderness|strong="H4057"\w*: Beth-arabah, Middin, Secacah,
Nibshan, the City of Salt, and En-gedi—six cities, along with their villages.

\w But|strong="H3808"\w* \w the|strong="H3117"\w* \w descendants|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* \w could|strong="H3201"\w* \w not|strong="H3808"\w* \w drive|strong="H3423"\w* \w out|strong="H3423"\w* \w the|strong="H3117"\w* \w Jebusites|strong="H2983"\w* \w living|strong="H3427"\w* \w in|strong="H3427"\w* \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*. \w So|strong="H3808"\w* \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w this|strong="H2088"\w* \w day|strong="H3117"\w* \w the|strong="H3117"\w* \w Jebusites|strong="H2983"\w* \w live|strong="H3427"\w* \w there|strong="H3427"\w* \w among|strong="H3427"\w* \w the|strong="H3117"\w* \w descendants|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*.
